Module c486.c486assessmentproject
Package Controller

Class ModifyProductController

java.lang.Object
Controller.ModifyProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyProductController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the ModifyProductController class that enables the user to modify an existing product's data.
It can do everything the AddProductController class can do, but uses a different method to update the existing products' data.
Once the user selects a product to modify from the parts table on the main form screen and clicks the modify button, they will be redirected to this screen.
All the text fields will automatically populate with that products' information.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addModifyAssociatedPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method adds the selected part from the top parts table into the bottom associated parts table.
    It adds the parts added into the associatedPartsTable into the Inventory associatedParts array list using the addAssociatedPart method.
    void
    blankTextError()
    This method displays an error alert dialog box letting user know a text field is left blank.
    void
    cancelToMain(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method confirms with the user before returning the user to the main form if the Cancel button is clicked.
    void
    getSelectedProduct(Product selectedProduct)
    This method populates the texts fields in the modify product screen with the selected product's information.
    It also gets the index of the selected product and initializes the static variable selectedIndex to be used with updateProduct method.
    void
    initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
    This method is the first method called when the modify product screen is opened.
    The method populates the parts table view at the top of the screen with all available parts in the inventory system.
    void
    onModifySearchParts(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method is used to search the allParts array list with the value entered into the search text field at the top of the screen.
    The method will either return the part matching the id entered, or the part matching the full or partial name given.
    If no part is found an error message will be displayed.
    void
    RemoveAssociatedPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method removes the selected part from the Inventory associatedParts array list after confirming removal is wanted.
    An error message will prompt the user if no associated part is selected before pressing the remove part button.
    void
    saveModifiedProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method does everything the saveProduct method does in the AddProductController class, but instead of using the Inventory class's addProduct method, it uses the Inventory class's updateProduct method.
    The selected product variable data is replaced with the newly entered data with the set method.
    This product variable is then passed into the updateProduct method which replaces that instance of product with the newly modified product instance.
    The user is returned to the main form page once the save button is clicked.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method is the first method called when the modify product screen is opened.
      The method populates the parts table view at the top of the screen with all available parts in the inventory system.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -

    • blankTextError

      public void blankTextError()
      This method displays an error alert dialog box letting user know a text field is left blank.

    • onModifySearchParts

      public void onModifySearchParts(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is used to search the allParts array list with the value entered into the search text field at the top of the screen.
      The method will either return the part matching the id entered, or the part matching the full or partial name given.
      If no part is found an error message will be displayed.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - When the enter key is pressed when the focus is on the search text field.

    • getSelectedProduct

      public void getSelectedProduct(Product selectedProduct)
      This method populates the texts fields in the modify product screen with the selected product's information.
      It also gets the index of the selected product and initializes the static variable selectedIndex to be used with updateProduct method.
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - - The product object selected by the user to be modified.

    • addModifyAssociatedPart

      public void addModifyAssociatedPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method adds the selected part from the top parts table into the bottom associated parts table.
      It adds the parts added into the associatedPartsTable into the Inventory associatedParts array list using the addAssociatedPart method.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - When the add button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - - If the user clicks add but does not select a part to be added.

    • RemoveAssociatedPart

      public void RemoveAssociatedPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method removes the selected part from the Inventory associatedParts array list after confirming removal is wanted.
      An error message will prompt the user if no associated part is selected before pressing the remove part button.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - When the remove associated part button is clicked.

    • saveModifiedProduct

      public void saveModifiedProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method does everything the saveProduct method does in the AddProductController class, but instead of using the Inventory class's addProduct method, it uses the Inventory class's updateProduct method.
      The selected product variable data is replaced with the newly entered data with the set method.
      This product variable is then passed into the updateProduct method which replaces that instance of product with the newly modified product instance.
      The user is returned to the main form page once the save button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - When the save button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - - When the user enters a String value inside a text field expecting a numerical value.

    • cancelToMain

      public void cancelToMain(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method confirms with the user before returning the user to the main form if the Cancel button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - When the user clicks the cancel button.
      Throws:
      IOException - - If the FXML file cannot be found.
